title: Is there  way to block tracking pixels?
content:
Is there a setting or add-on for firefox (Windows) that will block tracking pixels? My email client hi-lites when present and as I understand they are incorporated within images so I dont down load attached images to reduce them. On their pro version they allow blocking of these pixels. Unlike cookies there doesn't seem to be an option on reception to opt out. I'm not fully clear what harm they do or whether they are session use only and delete on power off. I would rather not recieve them atall. Companies when challenged smokescreen and refer to cookies rather than pixels or bang on about their companys integrity.

Thanks for your help

title: Firefox reopens one of the last tabs of the previous session
content: Hi! I've used Firefox for the past years without any issue, but then all of a sudden this problem appears. After i completely close Firefox and start it again, one of the previous tabs (with no apparent pattern) keeps showing up, together with www.google.com, my predefined home page. I didn't touch any setting, i have "Open previous windows and tabs" disabled by default, while i have Google as Custom URL (and empty pages for new tabs in the same window). I've already searched through the community (I found this post in particular that seemed pretty close to the problem i've been experiencing in the last few days: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1430663), but the tips didn't work for me, or they were already in my settings. If you have any advice i will try it. Thank you in advance and sorry for any grammatical mistakes
